headline: Why Analysts See Tesco’s Story Shifting As Modest Upgrades Challenge Its Valuation Discount
summary: Tesco’s fair value estimate has nudged higher from $4.70 to about $4.84 per share as analysts grow slightly more confident in the retailer’s ability to execute its strategy in a still fragile consumer environment. With the discount rate holding broadly steady at around 7.96% and revenue growth expectations edging up to roughly 2.86%, the market narrative is shifting toward a story of steady, if unspectacular, resilience. Read on to see how you can stay on top of these subtle but important...
